page.title: 09MULLION PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Mullion County Primary School takes children aged 5_11. It has no nursery education and no "rising-five" scheme. Cornwall Education Committee says it does not have the money for such schemes. The school has 217 children on roll, some of whom come from outside the catchment area, as their parents choose to send them there rather than to their local school. The fact that the new school was built 3 years ago is an attractive prospect as many of the other schools on the Lizard are in old buildings in need of repair.There are 7 full-time teachers at the school, and 2 part-time.The headteacher teaches 1/3rd of the week. A secretary helps the head with administration for 15 hours a week. An ancillary helps with the infants. Most of the pupils go to Mullion Comprehensive School when they leave.
